spanishExample: ¿Entiendes que él murió?
englishTranslation: Do you understand that he died?
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiendes: understand, you understand (Entender, present, 2nd person)
murió: died , he/she/it died (Morir, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Entendemos que quizás yo muera.
englishTranslation: We understand that maybe I will die.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendemos: understand, we understand (Entender, present, 1st person plural)
muera: die, I die (Morir, subjunctive, 1st person)

spanishExample: Entendí que el camino era largo.
englishTranslation: I understood that the path was long.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendí: understood, I understood (Entender, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Entendimos que el tercer barco era mejor que el segundo.
englishTranslation: We understood the third boat was better than the second one.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendimos: understood, we understood (Entender, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Entiende que su perro ha muerto, por eso está triste.
englishTranslation: He understands his dog has died, that’s why he is sad.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiende: understands, he/she/it understands (Entender, present, 3rd person)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Entiendo que esto es difícil, ella está muriendo.
englishTranslation: I understand this is difficult, she is dying.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiendo: understand, I understand (Entender, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: He entendido que quizás mueras.
englishTranslation: I have understood that maybe you die.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
he: "have", "I have" before a participle (Haber, present, 1st person)
mueras: die, you die (Morir, subjunctive, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Me gusta tanto que me muero.
englishTranslation: I like this so much that I’m dying.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
gusta: likes, he/she/it likes (Gustar, present, 3rd person)
me: "me" as an indirect object ("to me", "for me")
morirse: any use of morir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to to die)
muero: die, I die (Morir, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No creo que entienda qué pasa cuando ellos mueren.
englishTranslation: I don’t think she understands what happens when they die.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
"qué" in an implied question, not an actual question
creo: believe, I believe (Creer, present, 1st person)
entienda: understand, he/she/it understand (Entender, subjunctive, 3rd person)
mueren: die, they die (Morir, present, 3rd person plural)
pasa: passes, he/she/it passes (Pasar, present, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No entendieron que podían morir.
englishTranslation: They didn’t understand that they could die.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendieron: understood, they understood (Entender, preterite, 3rd person plural)
podían: "were able", "they were able" (Poder, imperfect, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: No entendió la película.
englishTranslation: She didn’t understand the movie.
vocabIncluded: entendió: understood, he/she/it understood (Entender, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No entendiste lo que dijeron en el avión.
englishTranslation: You didn’t understand what they said on the plane.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
entendiste: understood, you understood (Entender, preterite, 2nd person)

spanishExample: No entiendo por qué el cuarto coche es tan pequeño.
englishTranslation: I don’t understand why the fourth car is so small.
vocabIncluded: entiendo: understand, I understand (Entender, present, 1st person)
tan: "so" as an adverb right before an adjective or adverb

spanishExample: No me entiendes como ellos me entienden.
englishTranslation: You don’t understand me like they understand me.
vocabIncluded: entienden: understand, they understand (Entender, present, 3rd person plural)
entiendes: understand, you understand (Entender, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Quieren entender esta foto, porque no la habían entendido.
englishTranslation: They want to understand this picture, because they hadn’t understood it.
vocabIncluded: habían: "had", "they had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Quiero que entienda que tenemos más de diez niños aquí.
englishTranslation: I want her to understand that we have more than ten children here.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
de used to mean “than” in numerical comparisons
entienda: understand, he/she/it understand (Entender, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quiero que entiendan que él es el hermano mayor.
englishTranslation: I want them to understand he is the oldest brother.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiendan: understand, they understand (Entender, subjunctive, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Quiero que entiendas que necesitamos más aire.
englishTranslation: I want you to understand that we need more air.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entiendas: understand, you understand (Entender, subjunctive, 2nd person)
necesitamos: need, we need (Necesitar, present, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Si mueres, quieres que entendamos que no es fácil.
englishTranslation: If you die, you want us to understand that it isn’t easy.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
entendamos: understand, we understand (Entender, subjunctive, 1st person plural)
mueres: die, you die (Morir, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Tenemos que entender que si ella muere, no podemos hacer nada.
englishTranslation: We have to understand that if she dies, we can’t do anything.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
muere: dies, he/she/it dies (Morir, present, 3rd person)
